channel.title: Firefox proxy settings on workstations
channel.description:
Reading the documentation about proxy settings in various applications (for example, Gajim or Electrum), I wonder about the following:
1. When using firefox in the workstation, is it recommended to set proxy setting to a SOCKS5 at 10.152.152.10, and if so to which port? 2. Same question, for firefox running in Windows VM configured to connect through a Whonix Gateway, as explained in https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Other_Operating_Systems

item.title: Firefox proxy settings on workstations
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
yirgit:

When using firefox in the workstation, is it recommended to set proxy setting to a SOCKS5 at 10.152.152.10, and if so to which port?

Usual recommendation: donâ€™t use Firefox. As per https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Browser.

Pick any pre-configured port as per https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Stream_Isolation

item.title: Firefox proxy settings on workstations
item.dc:creator: yirgit
item.description:
Reading the documentation about proxy settings in various applications (for example, Gajim or Electrum), I wonder about the following:

  1. When using firefox in the workstation, is it recommended to set proxy setting to a SOCKS5 at 10.152.152.10, and if so to which port?
  2. Same question, for firefox running in Windows VM configured to connect through a Whonix Gateway, as explained in https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Other_Operating_Systems
